description: One of the three types of Haki. Observation Haki allows the user to sense the presence of others and predict their movements, even with their eyes closed. Also known as Mantra in Skypiea. This ability enables users to dodge attacks and sense enemies from a distance.

keyMoments.title: Rayleigh Demonstrates Observation Haki
keyMoments.description: Rayleigh demonstrates Observation Haki by predicting the giant elephant's attacks with his eyes closed, formally introducing this ability to Luffy.
keyMoments.significance: First formal explanation and demonstration of Observation Haki as part of the Haki system.

weaknesses: Can be overwhelmed by too many presences
Extreme emotions can interfere with it

description: One of the three types of Haki. Armament Haki allows the user to create an invisible armor that enhances both offensive and defensive capabilities. It can be used to bypass Devil Fruit defenses, particularly effective against Logia users. Advanced users can harden their body parts, turning them black.

keyMoments.title: Rayleigh Demonstrates Armament Haki
keyMoments.description: Rayleigh demonstrates Armament Haki by creating an invisible armor to block the elephant's attack and deliver a powerful counter, formally introducing this ability to Luffy.
keyMoments.significance: First formal explanation and demonstration of Armament Haki as part of the Haki system.

strengths: Can hit Logia Devil Fruit users
Can harden body parts for increased damage

description: The rarest of the three types of Haki, possessed by only one in several million people. Conqueror's Haki allows the user to exert their willpower over others, knocking out those with weak wills. Unlike the other types, it cannot be trained but grows stronger as the user develops as a person. It is said that all those who have conquered the seas possess this ability.

keyMoments.title: Rayleigh Demonstrates Conqueror's Haki
keyMoments.description: Rayleigh demonstrates Conqueror's Haki by knocking out the giant elephant with his willpower alone, formally introducing this rare ability to Luffy and confirming Luffy possesses it.
keyMoments.significance: First formal explanation of Conqueror's Haki, the rarest and most powerful type. Confirms Luffy's potential as a great pirate.

strengths: Can knock out weak-willed opponents instantly
Demonstrates user's potential as a great leader
Can be used to intimidate and assert dominance
Cannot be learned - must be innate
weaknesses: Cannot be controlled through training alone
Can harm innocent bystanders if not controlled
